name: lammps6
title: Carbon Nanotube: Deformation and Breaking
description: LAMMPS simulation of a carbon nanotube under uniaxial strain, followed by strain release to observe relaxation toward equilibrium, with temperature monitored throughout the process.
content:
Carbon nanotube under mechanical stress showing molecular bonds (pink), applied forces (blue arrows), and temperature evolution

Overview

This application simulates the mechanical deformation and failure of carbon nanotubes using LAMMPS (Large-scale Atomic/Molecular Massively Parallel Simulator). The simulation applies opposing forces to stretch the nanotube, modeling real-world mechanical stress scenarios in nanomaterial applications.

File Structure

  • run_sim.sh - Main simulation script that executes LAMMPS and updates visualization parameters
  • scripts/ - LAMMPS input files (unbreakable.lmp, unbreakable.data, unbreakable.inc)
  • output/ - Generated simulation results (trajectory.lammpstrj, temperature.csv, thermo_full.log)
  • analysis/visualization.ipynb - Jupyter notebook for creating animated visualizations

Creating the Animation

After running the simulation, use the Camber platform's Jupyter environment to analyze data and create the animated GIF:

  1. Open analysis/visualization.ipynb in Jupyter on Camber
  2. Execute all notebook cells to process trajectory data
  3. The notebook automatically generates cnt_trajectory.gif showing molecular bonds, applied forces, and temperature evolution

The visualization combines molecular structure rendering with real-time temperature plotting, providing comprehensive insights into nanotube mechanics under stress.
